In 2012 the Grateful Dead released Spring 1990, an 18-CD box set containing live performances recorded during the legendary San Francisco actÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s three-week, 25th anniversary tour. On September 9 the band follow-up that box set with the release of Spring 1990 (The Other One) featuring 23-CDs worth of music from that same tour.

The music on the box set was recorded by long-time Grateful Dead audio engineer John Cutler and mixed from the master 24-track analog tapes by Jeffrey Norman at Bob WeirÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s TRI Studios. David Glasser then mastered the music to HDCD specs.

These are eight extremely high- level Dead shows, each and every one of which would make a terrific CD releases.
